title_sort: john m. rogers to walt whitman, 11 april 1875
title: John M. Rogers to Walt Whitman, 11 April 1875
text: New BritainApril 11th 1875Dear Friend and SirAs I have just came acrost[across] one of your letter I thought I would write you a few Lines just to let you know that I have not for goting[forgotten] you. I am enjoying good health as well as my Family. Cince[Since] I last saw you I was Married I have bee Married two years to day I have got a little boy ten months old on the 18 of this month and I named him after you so you see I have not for goting[forgotten] you How is the times in Washington it has been hard times here but I have got through the winter allright[alright]. We have had very cold weather here it has been the coldest winter I ever experance[experience]. Work is very dull here now I am not doing much at preasant[present] how do you get alon[along] out there. I have been away from Brooklyn Two Years next fowl[fall] I was throwed[thrown] out of work in New York with about two Hundred others ten days before the panis[pains] from the American Bank, Note, CoCompany and did not do any thing till January 20th I came to New Britain ConnConnecticut and I have been here cince[since] I do not like it here I had rather be in the City some where how is Buisness[Business] there if you come on this way I should like to have you come and see me if you can not stay more than one day but I would like to have you make me a good visit I have got a fine boy I can tell you he is as prety[pretty] as a picture we all send Love I hope you will forgive me for not writing before this from your Affectionate Friend &c.John M RogersAddressJohn M RogersNew BritainConnConnecticutJohn M. RogersNew Britain ConnConnecticutApril '75(ansanswered & sent paper) John M. Rogers to Walt Whitman, 11 April 1875
